info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 24 at 12:14PM MST until November 24 at 1:15PM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a
* Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Madison County in southwestern Montana... Northeastern Gallatin County in south central Montana...
* Until 115 PM MST.
* At 1214 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 11 miles west of Bozeman to 6 miles northeast of Belgrade, moving southeast at 50 mph.
HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
SOURCE...Radar and webcams.
IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area.
This includes Interstate 90 between Belgrade and Bozeman Pass.
Locations impacted include... Bozeman, Belgrade, Gallatin Gateway, Four Corners, and Bozeman Hot Springs.
info.instruction: Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.

parameter.value: Snow Squall Warning til 1:15 PM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
National Weather Service: Snow Squall Warning until 1:15 PM MST. Slow down or delay travel! Be ready for a sudden drop to near zero visibility and icy roads in heavy snow.

parameter.value: Aviso de Turbonada de Nieve hasta 1:15 PM MST. Pobre visibilidad! Reduzca la velocidad!

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: Aviso de Turbonada de Nieve hasta las 1:15 PM MST. Reduzca la velocidad o retrase su viaje! Preparese para una caida repentina de visibilidad cercana a cero y carreteras heladas en nevadas fuertes.
